website_summaries.verdict: If your top priority in a toaster is extra long slots, this Oster is likely to meet that need, but is lacking otherwise in functionality and value.
pros: A uniquely-designed model that features extra long slots that are ideal for artisan breads
Has 2 long slots and easy-to-adjust bread guides to fit most types of breads and bagels
Fits 2 small pieces of bread in one slot
cons: Tends to toast unevenly, and burn frequently

customer_reviews.title: The best part of the toaster is the long opening for ...
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised. The best part of the toaster is the long opening for the toast. Sure, you can toast 4 regular slices of toast at the same time, but I like that I can now toast those oversized sourdough bread slices when I want to without cutting them in half.
customer_reviews.author: N. Wishek

customer_reviews.title: The only good thing about this toaster is the extra long slot
customer_reviews.text: The only good thing about this toaster is the extra long slot. Other than that, it's terrible. It toasts unevenly (burnt on the side of the bread, not toasted enough in the middle). It also burns very easily so it's been difficult to find just the right setting. I didn't realize that I would miss the ability to toast different items at different settings... i.e. bagel on one side, toast on the other. Our old toaster had a different setting for each side. I can't tell you how many bagels and pieces of toast we have thrown away. Now I get to throw the toaster away, too.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Davenport

customer_reviews.title: It's adequate!
customer_reviews.text: According to the Amazon reviews, 21st century technology hasn't progressed to where we can toast a long slice of bread evenly. With this goal beyond our reach, I figure there's no sense paying for a boutique toaster. This Oster is among the least expensive long slice units, and it does not have a nuisance beeper so I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Coronet BlueTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Uneven & Inconsistant
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit as recommendation from my daughter as she owns one and it appears to operate fine. However; my toaster does not live up to expectations as it does not toast evenly nor is it consistent with the dial from one day to day. Maybe it is just a lemon. As others have indicated some times it will be toasted ones side will be fine and the other side is unevenly toasted. When the elements are observed when "ON" some of the elements are barely glowing when others are cherry red (creating dark or burned spots on the bread).
customer_reviews.author: AuAgPicker

customer_reviews.title: Love this toaster
customer_reviews.text: Love this toaster. Some are complaining that it burns everything. But if you use the dial to your preferred brownness, then it works great. Now no one has to wait for their toast. And is slim enough for my small space.
customer_reviews.author: Txfirefly

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't toast Evenly
customer_reviews.text: We like having the longer and wider slots for big pieces of bread. The Frozen setting is great for waffles, etc., The one draw back is that it doesn't toast evenly. It mainly toasts on one side, but leaves the other side barely toasted. That isn't on the bagel setting, it's all the time. We thought we just had an odd one and deal with it. I bought the same toaster as a gift for my mom for Christmas. It does the same thing for her and drives her nuts. Silver lining, she would like a new toaster for Christmas again this year so at least I have one idea for something to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: How hard can this really be?
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this same model Oster when we built our house 10 years ago. Made from steel and aluminum (remember those?). Worked like a champ for 10 years. Just bought the same model, still made of steel and aluminum (post tariff). Feels like a toaster, nice sized slots for larger artisan bread, gets hot, toasts, finishes. I'll update after 60 days use, but I'm glad SOMEONE still makes stuff correctly and doesn't use all plastic.
customer_reviews.author: MaineBound

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your time playing
customer_reviews.text: Tried getting this thing to make properly toasted bread for 3 days. Not once did it ever toast the middle of the bread. Burned edges, soft middle. Tried placing bread in it multiple ways and even rotated throughout. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Rix

customer_reviews.title: Very Versatile, Great for Homemade Bread, Nice Look, No fingerprints
customer_reviews.text: So I recently purchased a new toaster after the old one finally got too yucky looking after about 10 years. I purchased one at a local retail store and I hated it. So off to Amazon to find another one, and this is the one I purchased. The previous one didn't easily accommodate homemade bread. I make a lot of homemade sourdough and needed something that could accommodate a non-commercial sized slice of bread. This one is perfect!! It works great for homemade bread, bagels, frozen items etc. The warm button is an especially nice feature that we actually use more than we anticipated. It's easily cleaned and doesn't show fingerprints. Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Denver's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster! I purchased to replace a four-slot toaster ...
customer_reviews.text: Great toaster! I purchased to replace a four-slot toaster we had for years that burned out on us. The unit toasts great. For us, setting "4" is the best for toasting bread for breakfast to get a nice golden brown. However, our family has found that it can sometimes be difficult to get toasted items out of the toaster without burning ourselves. Therefore, we invested in an affordable pair of bamboo toast tongs. I suggest those who do not have a pair order them if intending to purchase this toaster. Other than that, very happy with our purchase, and would recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy of Oz

customer_reviews.title: Too long
customer_reviews.text: First, I attempted several times to add a photo but your system showed "error". I've owned a silver Oster for many years and loved it. Since I needed a new one I chose the Oster Longer Four Slot toaster. The first disappointment is that the toaster is too long, extremely long. It takes up so much of the counter space that I could be using for other things. Second, it doesn't cook evenly, and when I add a little extra time, the bread burns. Third, It doesn't feel as heavy as the older Oster. Oster, generally, makes a great product but this toaster missed the boat.
customer_reviews.author: L. M.

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this toaster for a week, but it worked great right of the box. As per the instructions, I ran it empty on the highest setting a couple of times to burn of the packing dust/oils. So far the toast is evenly browned and nothing has gotten stuck. The "warm" feature is a neat way to reheat the toast if I didn't get it to my plate right away after toasting. I like the slim design and the cord is indeed short, but the outlet where I have it is nearby.
customer_reviews.author: AC in FL

customer_reviews.title: This toaster is a real waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This toaster is a real waste of money, I am completely dissatisfied with this Oster purchase. No matter what setting you use the toast comes out unevenly toasted; on setting #4 it will burn on one end and barely toast the other, on setting 3 it doesn't toast enough so you have to put it down a second time and watch it so it doesn't burn, and on setting 5 it burns completely which makes me wonder why there is even a setting 6 or 7. You just can't win with this toaster.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Havrilla

customer_reviews.title: Average toaster
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to accommodate toasting the longer slices of Italian bread. Sometimes it toasts just right, and other times it seems to toast uneven. I wish there were a lever that would lift the bread higher than the top of the toaster. I have to use a bamboo skewer to get the slices out. The setting dial is easy to use. Using the "frozen" option seemed to under-toast. I just thaw out the bread or whatever in the microwave and then toast it.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Junk.
customer_reviews.text: Nice in theory, but it malfunctions. From the first time we tried it, the lever often doesn't work and has to be held. down. Now after only 5 weeks there is an electrical burning smell. It's getting returned. Why can't they make a simple toaster anymore? It's not rocket science.
customer_reviews.author: guitarlady

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - NOT for deli sized bagels and most breads.
customer_reviews.text: Deli size bagels DO NOT fit in this toaster without trimming down the size. 4 slices of toast DO NOT fit in this toaster either. If you use frozen bagels and traditional sized white bread all will be well. Basically, a royal pain to use having to alter size of bread or bagel each time. Otherwise, very nice toaster. Toasts well and even, design is nice. Probably will sell this at my next garage sale and get a better one for my needs. 🥴
customer_reviews.author: Pamela C. Bieber

customer_reviews.title: A great value and looks good on the countertop.
customer_reviews.text: Love the ability to toast our artisan breads and it works just as it should to do just that. This one replaces our original bought in 2009 and the refinements make it even better. Our original was damaged through events not related to the the toaster so when we had to buy another the hunt was on. After all was said and done, reviews read, prices compared..we reupped with the Oster. Occasionally we get a little edge overcooking, however the breads have a lot to do with it. Happy customer to be able to have the full slices of artisan bread toastin again.
customer_reviews.author: Superdave

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster and looks great, too!
customer_reviews.text: My husband picked out this toaster and I agreed it was perfect for us. We love bagels and they fit nicely into the slots. We also love pumpernickel and sourdough breads, which are oversized, and they come out perfectly toasted, too. The look of this toaster is industrial-chic and goes with any kitchen decor. So glad he saw this toaster on Amazon and it's been working perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Mostgirlicious

customer_reviews.title: Bread Incinerator
customer_reviews.text: Incinerates bread to black ash at any setting. If you need to get rid of a body and have the time to cut it up small enough you could immolate the parts in this toaster. But, I don't think that is it's intended use? You want to make toast rather than charred remains? This is not the item for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs some help, then works good
customer_reviews.text: Long but looks great in the kitchen. I like the multiple settings and options. I had to use a knife and pop out some of the wires so they could heat up, but after I did the bread was uniformly toasted. If you're toasting bagels BOTH sides turn on even if you have it on the bagel setting.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin & DD

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous Piece of Garbage
customer_reviews.text: First one received had a busted dial. The replacement received burned the toast and not a little. I mean it charred both slices black when set to only 4 which is only half power. The second try the element turned brilliant glowing orange set to only 2, popped loudly and ended with acrid fumes. This thing is a dangerous piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Dead after only 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased many Oster products over the years. They were durable and lasted for many years. However this product barely lasted 2yrs before the center element stopped working. Additionally, most of the print has completely worn off the buttons. We are a family of 2 adults, who maybe use the toaster once or twice a week. For $50 and low usage, I would have thought it would last much longer. Not a quality product for the money. Will definitely not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Carrow

customer_reviews.title: Great Toaster with Really Nice Features!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toaster with really nice features. I like that the a/c plug comes out the back of the unit - sounds easy enough but my last two toasters were not and it was awkward plugging in and pressing controls. The warm, bagel and frozen buttons are great bonuses too and so far, it seems to have done a great job toasting evenly. The one star deduction is because the outside tends to get a little hotter than I'd like; it takes a LONG time to cool down enough for me to put back in the cupboard.
customer_reviews.author: JazzInTheD

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster!
customer_reviews.text: I had a toaster like this before and it lasted for about 15 years. Was happy to be able to replace it with the same model. Nice that it holds 4 slices of bread at a time. Also nice to be able to hit a button for a longer setting (bagel or muffin).
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: *Revised Review: Shouldn't it toast both sides of the bread?
customer_reviews.text: Revised Review: I was laughing that the toaster came with such detailed directions. It's a toaster. Push the lever down. As it turns out, you must read the directions. It's imperative that you follow the first use instructions. If you do, you will be happy with this product. I originally gave this one star, but after following the correct procedure, I give it five stars. Original Review: My toaster is not toasting both sides of the bread. Also, one slice toasts more (on one side of the bread than the other) :-(
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn Dieda Madden

customer_reviews.title: Cool!
customer_reviews.text: Love this toaster! Didn't want the large size, but we did want to make for more than one person at a time. it's not heavy, and it looks like an airstream trailer on our counter :) toasts frozen waffles very well with the frozen button and just above medium on the dial.
customer_reviews.author: BLT

customer_reviews.title: Oster long toaster
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for Rye bread (wider slices that don't fit in standard size) and sausage rolls which toast very well with the bagel function which toasts the inside without burning the outside. Don't use it often but it's worked for a few years now w no problems. Recommended
customer_reviews.author: Big Spender

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: I like the style and the simplicity of the controls. What I don't like is the fact that the heating elements in the center of the slots are much hotter than the elements on the ends. Either you have one end of your toast burned and the other end is good or one end of the slice of bread is good and the other end isn't toasted.
customer_reviews.author: Paul E. Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I like that the entire bread slices fit in. (I buy bread from a bakery.) I am very disappointed that not all of the little coils actually heat up. There are large areas that never heat up (stay black rather than get red and hot). My previous toaster was an old one that was burning every slice every time, so this is an improvement, but I'm not likely to buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Oklahoma Wind

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to replace our old toaster which was very inconsistent. We liked the look of the toaster as it fit our appliance garage perfectly. We also liked the buttons that help you choose the type of bread you are toasting. Unfortunately, the bread toasts on one side but barely on the other. Both slots are the same. We have to turn the bread around half way to make it even. The toaster was bought before Christmas and due to the holidays it wasn't used until last week. The box for return had already been thrown away. Live and learn.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Toaster
customer_reviews.text: I am really disappointed with this toaster, I had one just like it and it was nice, but it quit working, so I thought I'd replace it with the same one. This is like a second, the finish wipes off it looks old and beat up and I've just had it since December.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: This toaster is great!
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster! I can toast rye bread, French bread or any other large slices without turning it up side down like I had to do in my old four slot toaster. This toaster has two long slots, so larger slices of bread fit without a problem, You can also toast four slices of regular bread at one time.
customer_reviews.author: M E Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Not what we expected from this brand name
customer_reviews.text: We have had our Oster toaster for about a year now, and the toasting abilities have slowly declined. We now have to toast the bread two times on the max toasting setting to make sure the bread is toasted to a light brown color. Perhaps we were just unlucky, but for the price of around $60, we had expected a much better quality. Now we are looking to purchase another toaster and it will not be an Oster toaster.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: Product works great & makes a lot at one time.
customer_reviews.text: Product works great. Holds four slices of bread and is big enough for thicker types of bread like deli bagels. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: jk

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and sleek
customer_reviews.text: Had a similar toaster, I think earlier model. It only lasted 3yrs, but it was heavy, almost daily use. This one is starting off just as good. Love the cool touch sides and long slots for those long sourdough slices. Always evenly toasts too. Has a sleek design that is easy to clean up too.
customer_reviews.author: C.S.

customer_reviews.title: The best toaster I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: Love the sleek size, the elegant look and that the toaster has a warming button for those moments you had to walk away while your breakfast got cold ! Do wish I could get a toaster cover this size but it is sexy looking as is.
customer_reviews.author: Retired teacher

customer_reviews.title: We must of gotten a bad unit. Toasts one side more
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this 2 slice toaster can actually toast 4 slices because of the extra long slots. It can also accommodate larger single slices. That’s the good news. The bad news is this unit performed poorly at best. One side toasted at a considerable hotter/faster rate, so you end up with one side of the toast being much more well toasted than the other. We had to send this unit back
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love it!! I usually purchase $10 toasters, so this was a splurge. My husband loves that his sourdough bread fits into the slots without any part sticking out. Toasts very evenly. I will toast 1/2 of an english muffin, and comes out great. It is used every day, sometime twice a day. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Finally a toaster for large long slices
customer_reviews.text: A great toaster, easy to set. Everyone has WIDE slots for bagels, but I don't eat many bagels. I do love wide loaf Artisian type breads and always had to cut the slices to fit, barely into a regular toaster. They all fit is this one no problem, and yes it is still wide enough to toast your bagels.
customer_reviews.author: allta sebac

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Once you get used to the setting and placement it worked great for me. Easily fits very long slices of Sourdough Bread you would buy at the store. Also fits fatter pieces that you would cut yourself. Great price and easy to clean with tray. Just save the headache of searching all others and buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Reno

customer_reviews.title: Uneven results
customer_reviews.text: This toaster was not cheap, but performed as if it was. Typical results were toast charred around the ends and pale in the middle. It's being donated now that I've replaced it with another toaster recommended by America's Test Kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: amelia d. becke

customer_reviews.title: Awful.
customer_reviews.text: Why is it so hard to find a decent toaster. I used the defrost button and it burned my toast. It does not toast the very top of the bread very well at all. Will be returning and try ordering another toaster. Toasting is inconsistent.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Campos

customer_reviews.title: Worst toaster I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this toaster after reading many reviews of the Oster 2-Slice toaster in hopes that this would deliver the same quality toasting. IT DOES NOT! There is NEVER an even toasting no matter where I place my bread, how many pieces are in or even the type (bread, bagel, etc). I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Could be better
customer_reviews.text: I like most things about the toaster, but as mentioned elsehwere, it toasts more on one side of the bread than the other, so to get toast, I had to take the slice out, turn it around, and toast again. I'll put up with it because with effort I get toast, but it is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great style
customer_reviews.text: I love the style of this toaster and it toasts way better than my previous toaster. I was also able to fit 3 english muffins in this toaster, I was pleased. My other toaster was a 4-slot toaster which i could toast each set of bread individually which was nice but I still love this toaster and am pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn E

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful design, but...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these toasters, one for my primary residence and one for my vacation home. It’s a beautiful design and fits perfectly on my counters. But, it’s amazing that in the 21st century Oster can’t make a toaster that roasts evenly on both sides!
customer_reviews.author: Alan R. Bond

customer_reviews.title: Long skinny toaster
customer_reviews.text: I have a skinny cabinet & this toaster fits into it just fine. I love it so much when the first one went Kaput after many years, I bought a 2nd one just like it. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: navy brat

customer_reviews.title: Not Safe!  Fire hazard.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in July 2017 and used only occasionally. This morning, I put in a biscuit to toast and pushed the lever down. As a I walked away, I heard a pop and turned around to see a flame inside the control area. On the plus side it did make good toast up until the time it caught fire.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Cook

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Product by Oster
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this toaster to replace the same model that I owned and used daily for more than 10-years. This is an excellent product that easily toasts up to four slices of bread or two bagles that have been cut in half at a time. The settings are easy to understand and use, and the toaster itself is a very attractive product.
customer_reviews.author: DVD

customer_reviews.title: Burns everything!
customer_reviews.text: We loved the look of the toaster and the ability to toast larger slices of bread without cutting off the sides. However, it has been very temperamental, we set the dial, one time it toasts perfectly, another it burns or doesn't toast enough even though we haven't changed the setting. BUT the worst part is that we purchased it exactly a year ago and today, it died. Will not buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Very good looking, however as most toasters doesn't toast evenly. For a fifty dollar toaster rather disappointing. I like the long slots, especially for Artisan bread. Also has a small footprint for a small kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Bloomfield

customer_reviews.title: Challenging toaster
customer_reviews.text: Inconsistent Browning. Have to have a net close by to catch your toast. It pops out in unpredictable directions & with great speed. Dogs sometimes get toast before me.
customer_reviews.author: pspan

customer_reviews.title: White Bread toasts nicely but heartier breads & bagels are a bit uneven ...
customer_reviews.text: Does the Job. Although the coils aren't evenly spaced within so it has some hot & cooler spots. White Bread toasts nicely but heartier breads & bagels are a bit uneven in toasting due to the uneven coils I suspect.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: We've used this toaster now for a few months. It burns edges and under-cooks the middles. It's hard to get the right temp. We've thrown away more bread with this toaster. It looked like it would fit in our kitchen, but the sleek design isn't worth the wasted bread and burnt toast. It only works okay when we have four slices in - otherwise it's no good at all.
customer_reviews.author: Holly S. Reslink

customer_reviews.title: Love this toaster
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, easy maintenance toaster. Have had it over 2 years now, and have no issues with it. Love the wide slots always! Does a darn fine job. Looks nice in the stainless steel and easy to clean. No disappointment with this toaster!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It is not the high quality to justify the price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice toaster because you can buy a round loaf with large slices to toast. When the "Frozen" light only is lit, the "toast" light does not go off. Also the cage in the left slot does not always squeeze the toast, so often it comes out bent from shrinking in the heat. And the dial is VERY FAR from accurate. Anything beyond a "3" is burnt toast! I would return it for a new one but I threw the box away.
customer_reviews.author: John merli

customer_reviews.title: reliable toaster !
customer_reviews.text: Love this toaster so much! Works great, fits four large slices of bread/bagels and toasts to perfection. I wanted a long thinner toaster to fit under my cupboard and it is exactly what I was looking for. Plus it’s really attractive so could stay out if you had counter space for it !
customer_reviews.author: A Mac

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for extra large bread or toasting frozen items
customer_reviews.text: We love this toaster because it fits our extra large bread in it. We can also do 4 slices of "regular sized" bread at one time. I also love that it has a button for bagels and also a button you can push if you are toasting frozen items. That "frozen" button gets used a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Cara Kerwin

customer_reviews.title: Cannot adjust darknesss.  Button seems loose and may be defective.  Burns everything.  Smells bad.
customer_reviews.text: Even though I've had this sine 10/3, I just opened it 12/18. Was waiting for a kitchen remodel to be completed. This is a horrible appliance.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Very nice product and very stylish looking
customer_reviews.text: Very nice product and very stylish looking. Crumb catcher is very easy to clean. It holds large pieces of bread and it works well but takes a little longer to toast. Otherwise very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mame

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The toaster broke conveniently just after the 1 year warranty. I hated this toaster from the beginning because it never toasted consistently. Set it on high and it barely toasted, other times it was on low and it would burn. Not consistently, always different so you would have to try and guess when the toast should be done.The handle will not click in to keep down to toast now. Way too expensive for a toaster that is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Baker

customer_reviews.title: Slim design
customer_reviews.text: I love this toaster. It replaced he same model that I had and loved. It’s slim design is what I like and doesn’t take up much counter space.
customer_reviews.author: M. Marciano-Forelli

customer_reviews.title: Uneven toasting
customer_reviews.text: When toasting bread, the outer edges (crust) toasts faster than the center of the bread slice. You need to toast the bread twice to toast the center. After a second toasting, the bread in the middle is perfect but the crust is burnt. I tried this at various toasting settings.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: I like the design
customer_reviews.text: I like the design. I like the crumb tray. That's about it. The first one we got had to be turned up all the way to 6 or 7 so it would toast at all and it was very irregular. Some untoasted spots and some burnt. So we sent it back and got a new one. That one was even worse. The middle was not toasted at all while the ends were always burnt. So no thank you. We got a different brand now and really hope that it works better.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed, doesn't toast well
customer_reviews.text: I liked the look of this toaster because it is slim and took up less space. I don't like how I have to turn the toast to get both sides of the bread toasted. It does not toast evenly no matter how many pieces of bread are in the toaster. Also, soon after the purchase the lettering on the buttons started to wear off. Not worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Jean Scott

customer_reviews.title: Good size. Nice finish
customer_reviews.text: Good size. Nice finish. Relatively even toasting. Not sure that the different settings buttons make much of a difference in outcome.
customer_reviews.author: K. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: A Toast to the toaster
customer_reviews.text: Works well , like the different selections fits nicely on counter nice finish on exterior
customer_reviews.author: James Frosco

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't toast evenly on both sides
customer_reviews.text: I saw other reviews before I purchased this toaster saying the same thing, but I had one I purchased several years ago and it worked great until that one suddenly 'sparked' and stopped working. This one I just received is cheaply made and doesn't toast evenly on both sides of the bread. It toasts fine on the inside of the bread, but not as well on the outside. Also, trying to get a return shipping label was difficult. Andy
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, BUY this!
customer_reviews.text: Sleek design. Fits 2 oversized breads (ie. sourdough or 4 regular slices. No crb leaks. Powerful heating (if you used to use higher heat, then you will want to turn the knob down a few clicks on this one)
customer_reviews.author: Trinity Tuttle

customer_reviews.title: Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: This toaster looks great on my counter. The outside doesn't get hot like some I've read about. We've been using it for a month with no problems. It fits everything I've wanted to toast so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kassy

customer_reviews.title: A great toaster, a great price
customer_reviews.text: A beautiful, clean designed toaster with all of the advanced controls. Works great. Even browning. Automatic. Simple controls. Wide long slots with auto centering. Cannot go wrong. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: bcapbcap

customer_reviews.title: Toasted
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sturdy toaster for the price, toasts evenly and is thin enough to not take up too much room in a small NYC apartment. The wide open long slots make it good choice for a variety of breads to toast.
customer_reviews.author: Earl Barrett-holloway

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the one just like it we got 15 years ago. This one toasts uneven if you are toasting long slices. Works fine for regular size bread.
customer_reviews.author: Grace

customer_reviews.title: Heat up in extreme style, with a little bread.
customer_reviews.text: The gorgeous full artisan-slice toaster that looks like an ‘Airstream Trailer’, looks GREAT on your counter! it’s so sleek, WOW....Look for yourself!
customer_reviews.author: William L. Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love the style, however it would not stay down so am getting a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Briney

customer_reviews.title: A Good Value and a Sleek Modern Look Toaster
customer_reviews.text: I love the slim line look, was tired of my bulky ugly looking 2-slice toaster. Love the wide slots to fit bagels without stuffing them in and its very simple to use. I have no issues with it so far, owned it 3 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: It toasts unevenly. Even at the highest setting, we generally get a serving of hot bread. This was a replacement of the identical older version. This one is certainly not new and improved.
customer_reviews.author: Ervin Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Large slot
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a similar model about 15 years old. Works as well as the previous one. Toasting is not perfect, but good enough for me. Long slots do accommodate large boule slices.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A Frelinger

customer_reviews.title: My Fav!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second. My first one was messed up when I moved. Had it for 12 years.
customer_reviews.author: Stella Georgopoulos

customer_reviews.title: Great toaster but makes a high pitched noise.
customer_reviews.text: I just bought the 4 slice Oster toaster. I hear a high pitched whine when I push the lever down to toast the bread. As soon it pops up it stops and I don't hear it.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Eastman

customer_reviews.title: Lasted about 9 months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toaster after EXTENSIVE research. I wanted a toaster that would toast both sides of the bread. Revolutionary concept I know. Our first toaster as a married couple lasted 4 years before it stopped toasting both sides. This toaster made it about 9 months, and now it won't even toast one side. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: WaljeMR

customer_reviews.title: Are you kidding... warmth??  HA!!
customer_reviews.text: it's a darn toaster it's supposed to be warm. Oh yeah, We love it!
customer_reviews.author: Mac MacChlerie

customer_reviews.title: OH, yes!
customer_reviews.text: The old multi-toaster finally gave out. Since we seemed to be always cutting our bread to fit the toaster, we liked the Long Slot design. The double meads two slices at a time! Or a complete hot dog roll. Two at at time! The bagel setting is awesome. I bought some blueberry bagels just to try it out. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert D

customer_reviews.title: I can put the whole slice and it toasts perfect. And then if I have regular slices
customer_reviews.text: I had an old 2 slot toaster that I had to keep cutting my sourdough bread in half. With this new Oster, I can put the whole slice and it toasts perfect. And then if I have regular slices, I can still toast 4 slices at a time. So glad I got it!
customer_reviews.author: Iris

customer_reviews.title: Worthless except as art
customer_reviews.text: Looks great on the counter but after just a couple of months it’s worthless. Heating elements appear to have taken a hike. Will only toast one side of bread regardless of position in the toaster. Definitely not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good value, I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.text: It IS sometimes uneven in toasting the inner slice. The bagel setting seems to toast both sides, so I don't know what it is for. But it does a nice job on my homemade ciabatta and other larger loaves. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark L. Witt

customer_reviews.title: Just Keep Shopping
customer_reviews.text: Eight months in, this toaster offers two options: cold or burnt. Although, sometimes it magically burns one half of a bagel & leaves the other seemingly untouched. Do yourself a favor, keep shopping.
customer_reviews.author: CCC

customer_reviews.title: It’s the perfect toaster for scali bread.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been looking for a long slot toaster. They’re not easy to find in stores.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Swanson

customer_reviews.title: Oyster Toaster.
customer_reviews.text: Toaster. Burns the edges doesnt toast the center of your bread. Bagel burns the edges even on lower control. Cant return it so My suggestion needs work on the burn coils...
customer_reviews.author: Laura Prescott

customer_reviews.title: Should have sent It back after 1st use but I ...
customer_reviews.text: Should have sent It back after 1st use but I didn't. Always have to turn bread around to have it toasted the same on both sides. Have checked all settings so I know that is okay. I think I just may have gotten a lemon!!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: it does not toast evenly
customer_reviews.text: I had this toaster before for years and really loved it. This one i recently purchased does not toast evenly, one side is always toasted more then the other. One side is burned and the other barely toasted .
customer_reviews.author: karen thiry

customer_reviews.title: Concept great, actual function only ok.
customer_reviews.text: Concept great, actual function only ok. Love that it accommodates any size slice of bread, but it doesnt toast surface evenly.
customer_reviews.author: yasky

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: This is our second toaster. Had the previous Oster for years. Very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Joe DIJoseph

customer_reviews.title: Publix breads fit this toaster to a T.
customer_reviews.text: I had previously had this toaster and loved it - it's especially great for toasting specialty breads from Publix, which are too long for conventional toasters.
customer_reviews.author: Scully

customer_reviews.title: Anyway you slice it
customer_reviews.text: Worked for our narrow space and fits just about any bread you put in it. Love the look as well.
customer_reviews.author: Aida Zihuatanejo

customer_reviews.title: RETURNED!!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this negative 5 stars if possible. I bought this toaster because it had mostly good reviews but I guess I got a lemon. On the lowest setting, it burned the toast on one side while the other side was barely toasted in spots and not toasted at all in others. I returned it today. I guess I need to look for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work right
customer_reviews.text: If I could give it no stars I would. After 2 months it was not toasting right as some coils were not working. It is also hard to get the levers to stay down. Looking for a new toaster after 3 months of ownership.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: The only toaster that met my expectations
customer_reviews.text: This was the only high quality toaster I could find that had long slots and a bagel setting that actually had an indicator letting you know the setting was turned on. I am unsure whether this combination of needs is in low demand or I am just a Luddite overlooking the more optimal solution that the rest of the world has moved on to.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Henry

customer_reviews.title: Not happy!
customer_reviews.text: I put up with this for a couple on months not toasting even and sold it on a garage sale site. Bought a Kenmore Elite to replace it. Best toaster on the planet!
customer_reviews.author: MIKEY 650i

customer_reviews.title: Not an even toast
customer_reviews.text: The unit is small and good for counters. We are a gluten free house and the bread seams to be lacking a consistent toast. We are disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Avidreader

product_meta.title: Oster Long Slot 4-Slice Toaster, Stainless Steel (TSSTTR6330-NP)
product_meta.description: Start your day with toast made your way using the Oster Long Slot 4-Slice Toaster. Offering extra-long slots and seven toast shade settings from light to dark, this stainless steel toaster is equipped to toast artisan-style breads, bagels, and more to your taste. The two extra-long slots can accommodate four standard bread slices or two larger, artisan-style breads or other food items. Dual bread guides automatically adjust to the thickness of the slices for perfect alignment and even browning on both sides, while Advanced Toasting Technology provides consistent, even results every time. A toast-lift lever promotes safe removal of toasted items. An anti-jam feature automatically shuts your toaster off in case of a jam for safe, hassle-free operation, and a cancel setting lets you stop the toasting process at any time. The removable, dishwasher-safe crumb tray makes cleanup simple.
feature_bullets: 4-slice stainless steel toaster with extra-long slots accommodates a variety of breads
Dual auto-adjusting bread guides adjust to bread thickness for even toasting
Advanced Toasting Technology ensures consistent results time after time
7 toast shade settings from light to dark to customize toast's crispness and darkness
Removable, dishwasher-safe crumb tray for easy cleaning

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars940 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
